intro: Himas angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf himalayan plant, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring to early summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
